paths

Class Path

  • java.lang.Object
    • paths.Path
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPath
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Arc, Blender, Composite, CubicBezier, Flower, InfinitySymbol, Lissajous, Path2, Superellipse, Supershape

    public abstract class Path
extends java.lang.Object
implements IPath
    A continuous sequence of points in 2D space.

    More information on paths
    Author:
    James Morrow [jamesmorrowdesign.com]

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PGraphics g,
                 float u1,
                 float u2)
        Description copied from interface: IPath
        Draws a segment of the path starting at trace(u1) and ending at trace(u2).
        Specified by:
        draw in interface IPath
        Parameters:
        g - A PGraphics object on which to draw the path
        u1 - The 1D coordinate of the segment's start, a value between 0 and 1
        u2 - The 1D coordinate of the segment's end, a value between 0 and 1

      • trace

        public abstract void trace(Point pt,
                           float u)
        Description copied from interface: IPath
        A continuous function from real values (floats) to Points.

        Maps a given floating point number from 0 to 1 to a given Point along the perimeter of the Path.
        Specified by:
        trace in interface IPath
        Parameters:
        pt - The Point in which the result is stored.
        u - A number from 0 to 1.

      • isReversed

        public boolean isReversed()
        Returns:
        true, if the path is set to reversed and false otherwise
